habitat_description:
Southwest:
Taxonomic status of the texanus subspecies of S. aquaticus is marginal since only a single record has been documented - that being from Presidio County, TX in 1887 (Allen 1891, Allen 1893, Schmidly 2004). In 1951, a mole of uncertain taxonomy was discovered across the border in Mexico's Sierra del Carmen mountains. However, exhaustive surveys have not been undertaken and the status remains unclear. NatureServe's "Critically Imperiled" conservation status and the isolated nature of the potential range lead me to create a range and model for this subspecies. MJR 11 June 2014.
